camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.milo-server.bindAddresse.name: camel.component.milo-server.bindAddresses
camel.component.milo-server.bindAddresse.description: Set the addresses of the local addresses the server should bind to

camel.component.milo-server.namespaceUri.name: camel.component.milo-server.namespaceUri
camel.component.milo-server.namespaceUri.description: The URI of the namespace, defaults to urn:org:apache:camel

camel.component.milo-server.path.name: camel.component.milo-server.path
camel.component.milo-server.path.description: The path to be appended to the end of the endpoint url. (doesn't need to start with '/')

camel.component.milo-server.port.name: camel.component.milo-server.port
camel.component.milo-server.port.description: The TCP port the server binds to

camel.component.milo-server.bridgeErrorH.name: camel.component.milo-server.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.milo-server.bridgeErrorH.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.milo-server.basicPropert.name: camel.component.milo-server.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.milo-server.basicPropert.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.milo-server.defaultCerti.name: camel.component.milo-server.defaultCertificateValidator
camel.component.milo-server.defaultCerti.description: Validator for client certificates using default file based approach

camel.component.milo-server.enableAnonym.name: camel.component.milo-server.enableAnonymousAuthentication
camel.component.milo-server.enableAnonym.description: Enable anonymous authentication, disabled by default

camel.component.milo-server.securityPoli.name: camel.component.milo-server.securityPoliciesById
camel.component.milo-server.securityPoli.description: Security policies by URI or name. Multiple policies can be separated by comma.

camel.component.milo-server.userAuthenti.name: camel.component.milo-server.userAuthenticationCredentials
camel.component.milo-server.userAuthenti.description: Set user password combinations in the form of user1:pwd1,user2:pwd2 Usernames and passwords will be URL decoded

camel.component.milo-server.usernameSecu.name: camel.component.milo-server.usernameSecurityPolicyUri
camel.component.milo-server.usernameSecu.description: Set the UserTokenPolicy used when One of: [None] [Basic128Rsa15] [Basic256] [Basic256Sha256] [Aes128_Sha256_RsaOaep] [Aes256_Sha256_RsaPss]
